0.html: A KAPLAY plugin that integrates PlanckJS, while keeping the simple/fun API of KAPLAY.
0.text: A KAPLAY plugin that integrates PlanckJS, while keeping the simple/fun API of KAPLAY.
0.title: KaPlanck

1.html: Planck.js is JavaScript/TypeScript rewrite of the Box2D C++ physics engine for cross-platform game development.
1.text: Planck.js is JavaScript/TypeScript rewrite of the Box2D C++ physics engine for cross-platform game development.
1.title: PlanckJS

2.html: KAPLAY (/ˈkæpleɪ/) is a JavaScript and TypeScript game library that makes it easy to create games for the web. It's free, open-source and fun.
2.text: KAPLAY (/ˈkæpleɪ/) is a JavaScript and TypeScript game library that makes it easy to create games for the web. It's free, open-source and fun.
2.title: KAPLAY

3.html: Please read both PlanckJS' and KAPLAY's documentation. Understanding how each of the libraries work is crucial to effectively use KaPlanck. Once you have a good grasp on both libraries, you can proceed to Getting Started.
3.text:
Please read both PlanckJS' and KAPLAY's documentation. Understanding how each of the libraries
work is crucial to effectively use KaPlanck. Once you have a good grasp on both libraries, you can proceed to Getting Started.
3.title: Before You Start

8.html:
KaPlanckPlugin(opt?): (k) => KaPlanckPluginCtx

A plugin to allows to use PlanckJS seamlessly with KAPLAY.

IMPORTANT

Vec2 from KAPLAY and Vec2 from PlanckJS are different, please use them accordingly.

PlanckJS uses radians for angles while KAPLAY uses degrees, please make use of KAPLAY's tools to convert between them.
8.text:
KaPlanckPlugin(opt?): (k) => KaPlanckPluginCtx

A plugin to allows to use PlanckJS seamlessly with KAPLAY.
IMPORTANT
Vec2 from KAPLAY and Vec2 from PlanckJS are different, please use them accordingly.
PlanckJS uses radians for angles while KAPLAY uses degrees, please make use of KAPLAY's
tools to convert between them.
8.title: Function: KaPlanckPlugin()

17.html:
addToDestroyList(): void

Adds the game object to a list of objects that will be destroyed when the world is not locked.

Please consider using addToDestroyList from kpWorld instead of this method, as this will require to lookup the parent game object with kpWorld component.
17.text:
addToDestroyList(): void

Adds the game object to a list of objects that will be destroyed when the world is not locked.
Please consider using addToDestroyList from kpWorld instead of this method, as this will
require to lookup the parent game object with kpWorld component.

361.html:
kpBody(def?, collisionIgnore?): KPBodyComp

Adds a body to the physics world.

Requires to be a child of an object with the kpWorld component. Requires kpPos. Requires kpRotate.

378.html:
kpFixture(def?): KPFixtureComp

Creates a fixture.

IMPORTANT: Cannot be added before kpBody if kpBody is used in the same game object. Otherwise, it requires to be a child of an object with the kpBody component.

Requires a shape.

404.html:
onKPCollide(tagA, tagB, action, worldContainer?): void

Register an event that runs once when 2 game objs with certain tags collides. Requires an object with the kpWorld component. Requires objects with kpFixture component.

IMPORTANT: Please do not destroy the objects that are listening to this event. If you would like to destroy them, please consider using addToDestroyList from kpWorld or kpBody.
404.text:
onKPCollide(tagA, tagB, action, worldContainer?): void

Register an event that runs once when 2 game objs with certain tags collides.
Requires an object with the kpWorld component.
Requires objects with kpFixture component.
IMPORTANT: Please do not destroy the objects that are listening to this event.
If you would like to destroy them, please consider using addToDestroyList from kpWorld or kpBody.
404.title: onKPCollide()

405.html:
ParameterTypeDescription
tagAstringThe tag of an object to listen for collisions.
tagBstringThe tag of another object to listen for collisions.
action(objA, objB, contact?) => void
worldContainer?GameObj<KPWorldComp>If not provided, the first object with kpObj will be used.

407.html:
onKPCollideEnd(tagA, tagB, action, worldContainer?): void

Register an event that runs once when 2 game objs with certain tags stop colliding. Requires an object with the kpWorld component.

IMPORTANT: Please do not destroy the objects that are listening to this event. If you would like to destroy them, please consider using addToDestroyList from kpWorld or kpBody.

onKPCollideUpdate(tagA, tagB, action, worldContainer?): void

Requires an object with the kpWorld component.

IMPORTANT: Please do not destroy the objects that are listening to this event.
